raw_text:
Mirza shocks Kuznetsova
 
 Sania Mirza continued her remarkable rise with victory over US Open champion Svetlana Kuznetsova at the Dubai Championships on Tuesday.
 
 The 18-year-old Indian, who is already a huge star in her home country, won 6-4 6-2 in front of a delirious crowd. It was Mirza's sixth straight victory following her first WTA tournament win in Hyderabad last month. Earlier, Daniela Hantuchova built on her improving form with a 7-6 6-2 win over sixth seed Alicia Molik. Mirza needed attention to an ankle injury after the second game against Kuznetsova.
 
 She quickly slipped 4-0 down but staged a dramatic comeback that thrilled the large Indian contingent in the crowd. "I really didn't expect that after my ankle turn," said Mirza. "I played a great match and I think (the crowd) did it again. I knew that I had to play an all-round game and that's what happened. "I did everything well but I wasn't missing the ball - I don't know how that happened." Mirza plays Silvia Farina Elia or Jelena Jankovic next. Hantuchova has risen from 31 in the world at the turn of the year to number 22, having reached the quarter-finals and semi-finals at her last two events. "It was such a tough first-round match and I am glad to come through," said Hantuchova. "She was serving so well. I just decided to hang in there and keep fighting." The Slovakian will meet Elena Likhovtseva in the second round after the Russian struggled past Tunisian wild card Selima Sfar 2-6 6-2 7-6. Likhovtseva needed nine match points before seeing off Sfar, who got a point penalty for swearing in the third set. Seventh seed Nathalie Dechy and Elena Bovina were among other first-round winners on Tuesday.
llama3.2:1b:
Sania Mirza beat Svetlana Kuznetsova 6-4 6-2 at the Dubai Championships. 

Mirza had an ankle injury before the match but played a strong comeback, winning 4 games down 3-0 and then leading 9-7 in the third set to win.

She will play either Silvia Farina Elia or Jelena Jankovic next.
llama3.2:3b: Sania Mirza defeated US Open champion Svetlana Kuznetsova 6-4 6-2 at Dubai Championships, overcoming an ankle injury to stage a dramatic comeback. Daniela Hantuchova also won, defeating Alicia Molik 7-6 6-2, while Silvia Farina Elia and Jelena Jankovic will face Mirza in the next round.
gemma2:2b: Sania Mirza defeated Svetlana Kuznetsova to win the Dubai Championships.  Daniela Hantuchova also won her match against Alicia Molik.  Likhovtseva advanced after a tough match against Selima Sfar.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Sania Mirza won her second consecutive WTA tournament with victory over US Open champion Svetlana Kuznetsova at the Dubai Championships, drawing a large crowd. Mirza played well despite not receiving support from the team that had previously supported her in Hyderabad. She struggled to match the quality of play she achieved earlier and needed attention for an ankle injury. Despite facing difficulties, she managed to stage a comeback and win the match with ease. Mirza's next opponent is Silvia Farina Elia or Jelena Jankovic. Hantuchova won her first-round match against Elena Likhovtseva 2-6 6-4 7-6, while Dechy and Bovina were among others who won their second round matches.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Sania Mirza beat US Open champion Svetlana Kuznetsova 6-4, 6-2 at the Dubai Championships, extending her win streak to six consecutive matches following her previous WTA victory in Hyderabad. Daniela Hantuchova also won her match against Alicia Molik with a score of 7-6(0) over 31st-ranked Molik.
qwen2.5:3b: Mirza defeated Kuznetsova at Dubai Championships, winning 6-4 6-2. She faced an ankle injury but staged a comeback to win. Mirza next plays against Farina Elia or Jankovic. Hantuchova improved from 31st world ranking and will face Likhovtseva in the second round after beating wild card Sfar.

Sanita Mirza continued her remarkable rise by defeating Svetlanna Kuznetsova at the Dubai Championships in Dubai, UAE, winning 6-4 and 6-2. The Indian tennis player had ankle surgery after her first WTA tournament win in Hyderabad but recovered well for this match. Mirza needed a lot of attention to an ankle injury after the second game but still managed a thrilling comeback that thrilled the large Indian crowd. Mirza plays Silvia Farina Eli or Jeleena Jankovic next, who played her first WTA tournament in Dubai in December 2019 and reached the quarter-finals and semi-finals in both events.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Mirza defeats Kuznetsova with an all-round game in Dubai Championships, ending a run of US Open victories for the American. Despite her injury-plagued start to the year, Mirza's rise continues as she moves up 18 places from 31 to number 22 in the world rankings. Hantuchova also advances after her impressive victory against Molik, while Silvia Farina Elia or Jelena Jankovic could be next for Mirza.
